cd:Time.cd:Description: Start of observation time for the first BRC in processed Mie calibration data
Start of observation time for the last BRC in processed Mie calibration data
Start of observation time for the first BRC in processed Rayleigh calibration data
Start of observation time for the last BRC in processed Rayleigh calibration data

cd:Float.cd:Description: Laser wavelength in nanometers
Mie error quantifier K1
Mie error quantifier K2
Mie error quantifier K3
Rayleigh error quantifier Ka2
Rayleigh error quantifier Ka3
Rayleigh error quantifier Kb2
Rayleigh error quantifier Kb3
Telescope Tripod Obscuration correction for one column
Radiometric gain factor for the Mie signal
Radiometric gain factor for the Rayleigh signal
Time duration the signal remains in the memory zone for the Mie
Time duration the signal remains in the memory zone for the Rayleigh

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Number of Fourier terms used in the Harmonic Bias Estimation (NF). The A and B coefficient lists for both Mie and Rayleigh below must be NF_Order+1 elements in size

cd:Array.cd:Description: The maximum size NF+1 of this array is 1024

cd:Float.cd:Description: One element of vector A

cd:Array.cd:Description: The maximum size NF+1 of this array is 1024. Note that the first B coefficient in this array (i.e. b_0) is not used by the L1bP. This is done so that the A and B coefficient arrays are both the same size. Only the last NF coefficients are used in the B coefficient array (for A, all NF+1 coefficients are used)

cd:Float.cd:Description: One element of vector B

cd:Array.cd:Description: The maximum size NF+1 of this array is 1024

cd:Float.cd:Description: One element of vector A

cd:Array.cd:Description: The maximum size NF+1 of this array is 1024. Note that the first B coefficient in this array (i.e. b_0) is not used by the L1bP. This is done so that the A and B coefficient arrays are both the same size. Only the last NF coefficients are used in the B coefficient array (for A, all NF+1 coefficients are used)

cd:Float.cd:Description: One element of vector B
Bias for the off-nadir Rayleigh measurements
Bias for the off-nadir Mie measurements
Bias for the nadir Rayleigh measurements
Bias for the nadir Mie measurements
Reference range with 0 MHz/km bias for off-nadir pointing measurements
Reference range with 0 MHz/km bias for nadir pointing measurements

cd:Integer.cd:Description: TRUE = Mie Response Calibration is valid. Based on acceptable ranges of calibration results for measurement and reference pulse; and the number of valid frequencies
Number of Mie frequency step results

cd:Float.cd:Description: Frequency offset

cd:Integer.cd:Description: TRUE = Satisfied minimum number of valid measurements per frequency step
TRUE = Measurement response is valid
TRUE = Reference pulse channel response is valid

cd:Float.cd:Description: Measurement channel response
Measurement Error_Mie_Response
Reference pulse channel response
Reference pulse Error_Mie_Response
Measurement mean sensitivity (slope of the best straight line of channel response)
Measurement zero frequency response (intercept of the best straight line of channel response)
Measurement Error_Mie_Response standard deviation
Measurement zero response frequency (x-intercept of the best straight line of channel response)
Reference pulse mean sensitivity (slope of the best straight line of channel response)
Reference pulse zero frequency response(intercept of the best straight line of channel response)
Reference pulse Eror_Mie_Response standard deviation
Reference pulse zero response frequency (x- intercept of the best straight line of channel response)

cd:Integer.cd:Description: TRUE = Mean sensitivity within threshold range
TRUE = Error Response standard deviation within threshold range
TRUE = Zero frequency response within threshold range
TRUE = measurement data is monotonic

TRUE = Rayleigh Response Ground Calibration is valid. Based on acceptable ranges of calibration results for measurement and reference pulse; and the number of valid frequencies
Number of Rayleigh frequency step results
Number of Rayleigh ground frequency step results

cd:Float.cd:Description: Frequency offset

cd:Integer.cd:Description: TRUE = Satisfied minimum number of valid measurements per frequency step
TRUE = Satisfied minimum number of valid ground measurements per frequency step
TRUE = Measurement response is valid
TRUE = Ground measurement response is valid
TRUE = Reference pulse channel response is valid

cd:Float.cd:Description: Measurement channel response
Measurement Error Rayleigh Response
Ground measurement channel response
Ground Measurement Error Rayleigh Response
Reference pulse channel response
Reference pulse Error_Rayleigh_Response

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Number of polynomial fit coefficients

cd:Float.cd:Description: Measurement mean sensitivity (slope of the best straight line of channel response)
Measurement zero frequency response (intercept of the best straight line of channel response)
Measurement Error_Rayleigh_Response standard deviation
Measurement zero response frequency (x-intercept of the best straight line of channel response)
One fit coefficient of the polynomial fit of the measurement response errors

Ground measurement zero frequency response (intercept of the best straight line of channel response)

TRUE=data has been use for the Mie wind processing
Number of sampling points for the Mie non-linearities for the internal path
Number of sampling points for the Mie non-linearities for the atmospheric path

cd:Array.cd:Description: ACCD pixel offsets from the linear fit of the internal reference responses
ACCD pixel offsets from the linear fit of the atmospheric responses

cd:Record.cd:Description: Copy of part of the parameters of PAR_1B data

cd:Float.cd:Description: Correction factor for the calculation of the Mie SR with Mie Core 2.
Correction factor for the calculation of the Mie SR with Mie Core 3.

cd:Integer.cd:Description: Summation backscatter index for calculation of SNR and ratio.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Coefficient for x^3 in cubic correction of refined SR calculation.
Coefficient for x^2 in cubic correction of refined SR calculation.
Coefficient for x^1 in cubic correction of refined SR calculation.
Coefficient for x^0 in cubic correction of refined SR calculation.

cd:Record.cd:Description: Structure containing the values for Mie and Rayleigh mode mean DCO values and the standard deviation for reference pulse and atmospheric data. Parameters are only filled if Do_Mode_Mean_DCO_Pre_Processing = TRUE and Use_DCO_Correction_Lidar_Atmos = TRUE

cd:Float.cd:Description: Mode mean DCO value calculated for the Mie reference pulses.
Standard deviation of the Mie reference pulse DCO values.
Standard error of the mean of the Mie reference pulse DCO values.
Mode mean DCO value calculated for the Rayleigh reference pulses.
Standard error of the mean of the Rayleigh reference pulse DCO values
Standard deviation of the Rayleigh reference pulse DCO values.

cd:Array.cd:Description: List of mode mean Mie DCO values calculated for the 24 atmospheric layers and the background bin.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Mode mean Mie DCO value for one row.

cd:Array.cd:Description: List of the standard deviation of Mie DCO values for the 24 atmospheric layers and the background bin.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Standard deviation of the individual Mie DCO values for one row.

cd:Array.cd:Description: List of the standard error of the mean of the Mie DCO values for the 24 atmospheric layers and the background bin.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Standard error of the mean of the Mie DCO values for one row.

cd:Array.cd:Description: List of mode mean Rayleigh DCO values calculated for the 24 atmospheric layers and the background bin.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Mode mean Rayleigh DCO value for one row.

cd:Array.cd:Description: List of the standard deviation of Rayleigh DCO values for the 24 atmospheric layers and the background bin.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Standard deviation of the Rayleigh DCO values for one row.

cd:Array.cd:Description: List of the standard error of the mean of the Rayleigh DCO values for the 24 atmospheric layers and the background bin.

cd:Float.cd:Description: Standard error of the mean of the Rayleigh DCO values for one row.
